treatment.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Anthemideae;genus Artemisia;species cana;subspecies cana;
treatment.description: Shrubs, 100–150 cm. Stems white to light gray or brown. Leaves whitish gray, blades narrowly elliptic to lanceolate, 2–8 × 0.3–1 cm, usually entire, sometimes irregularly lobed, densely silvery-canescent. Heads in (leafy) arrays 10–20 × 5–7 cm. Involucres broadly campanulate, 3–4 × 3–5 mm. Phyllaries broadly ovate (mostly obtuse), densely hairy. Florets 10–20. Cypselae 1–1.2 mm. 2n = 54.

habitat_info.text: sandy loam soils , often along streams ;

treatment.discussion: Subspecies cana is found primarily in the grasslands of Canada and the west-central United States. It is unusual within the species in that there is no morphologic evidence of hybridization with other species in subg. Tridentatae.
